content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 3.72 - Executive Order No. 72: Directing the Attorney General to inquire into the operation, management and funding of hospitals

State Regulations
TO: THE HONORABLE LOUIS J. LEFKOWITZ..................................................... ATTORNEY GENERAL OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK................................... STATE CAPITOL............................................................................ ALBANY, NEW YORK....................................................................... WHEREAS, New York State has long recognized that it has a
responsibility to ensure the availability of proper health care to all its
citizens, including the economically disadvantaged; and
WHEREAS, approximately one billion dollars in public funds
are expended annually through the New York State Medical Assistance Program to
various hospitals for the purpose of insuring that citizens eligible for such
assistance are provided with necessary hospital services; and
WHEREAS, the State has a clear interest and responsibility
to see that such public funds are expended properly, and not in an
unauthorized, wasteful or fraudulent manner; and
WHEREAS, numerous reports have been published alleging
waste, mismanagement, fraud and abuse in the use of public funds provided for
the care of hospital patients; and
WHEREAS, on September 30, 1977, the Commissioner of the New

York State Department of Health and the Acting Commissioner of the New York

State Department of Social Services requested that you investigate and
prosecute, pursuant to subdivision 3 of section
63
of the

Executive Law, the alleged commission of any indictable offense or offenses in
violation of the Public Health Law or the Social Services Law or in relation to
any matters connected with the New York State Department of Health or the New

York State Department of Social Services by hospitals subject to the provisions
of the Public Health Law or Social Services Law; and
WHEREAS, the Deputy Attorney General for Nursing Homes, Health and Social Services has advised me that many of the types of waste, mismanagement, fraud and abuse which have been discovered in his investigation
of nursing homes also exist in the hospital industry, and that there is a need
for a civil investigation pursuant to subdivision 8 of section
63
of the

Executive Law into the operation, management and funding of hospitals to
provide the information necessary to ensure appropriate executive action with
respect to such matters; NOW, THEREFORE, pursuant to subdivision 8 of section
63
of the

Executive Law, and in accordance with the statute and law in such case made and
provided, I find it to be in the public interest that you inquire into matters
concerning the public peace, public safety and public justice with respect to
the operation, management and funding of hospitals, and any principal, operator, agent, supplier or other person connected therewith, and I so direct
you to do so in person or by your assistant or deputies and to have the powers
and duties specified in such subdivision 8 for the purpose of this
requirement. Signed: Hugh L. Carey

Dated: June 5, 1978
